Package org.maxicp.cp.engine.core

Interface SequenceVar

All Known Implementing Classes:
SequenceVarImpl
public interface SequenceVar
decision variable used to represent a sequence of nodes the nodes are split into 3 categories: - scheduled nodes, which are part of the sequence and ordered - possible nodes, which could be part of the sequence - excluded nodes, which cannot be part of the sequence

    • schedule

      void schedule(int pred, int node)
      set the node into the sequence, right after a predecessor. Fails if the node is in the excluded set, no effect if it is already in the scheduled set
      Parameters:
      pred - predecessor for the node
      node - node to schedule

    • canSchedule

      boolean canSchedule(int pred, int node)
      tell if a node can be scheduled with a given predecessor
      Parameters:
      pred - predecessor for the node
      node - node trying to be scheduled
      Returns:
      true if the node can be scheduled

    • canPrecede

      boolean canPrecede(int pred, int node)
      tell if a node can precede another one a node p can precede a node n if a sequence can be formed where p occurs before n in the order
      Parameters:
      pred - predecessor for the node
      node - node
      Returns:
      true if a sequence can be formed with pred preceding node

    • exclude

      void exclude(int node)
      exclude the node from the set of possible nodes. Fails if the node is in the scheduled set, no effect if it is already in the excluded set
      Parameters:
      node - node to exclude

    • excludeAllPossible

      void excludeAllPossible()
      exclude all possible nodes from the sequence, binding the variable

      boolean isScheduled(int node)
      tell if a node is scheduled
      Parameters:
      node - node whose state needs to be known
      Returns:
      true if the node is scheduled

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      tell if a node is excluded
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • fillScheduled

      int fillScheduled(int[] dest)
      Copies the scheduled values of the domain into an array. Always contain the begin() and end() nodes
      Parameters:
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nScheduledNode(true)
      Returns:
      the size of the scheduled domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the scheduled domain in an arbitrary order

    • fillPossible

      int fillPossible(int[] dest)
      Copies the possible values of the domain into an array.
      Parameters:
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nPossible()
      Returns:
      the size of the possible domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the possible domain in an arbitrary order

    • fillExcluded

      int fillExcluded(int[] dest)
      Copies the excluded values of the domain into an array.
      Parameters:
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nExcluded()
      Returns:
      the size of the excluded domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the excluded domain in an arbitrary order

    • fillScheduledInsertions

      int fillScheduledInsertions(int node, int[] dest)
      Copies the scheduled insertions values of the domain into an array.
      Parameters:
      node - node whose scheduled insertions (predecessor candidate) needs to be known
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nScheduledInsertions(node)
      Returns:
      the size of the scheduled insertion domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the scheduled insertion domain in an arbitrary order

    • fillPossibleInsertions

      int fillPossibleInsertions(int node, int[] dest)
      Copies the possible insertions values of the domain into an array.
      Parameters:
      node - node whose possible insertions (predecessor candidate) needs to be known
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nPossibleInsertions(node)
      Returns:
      the size of the possible insertion domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the possible insertion domain in an arbitrary order

    • nPossibleInsertions

      int nPossibleInsertions(int node)
      give the number of possible insertions for a node
      Parameters:
      node - node whose number of possible insertions needs to be known
      Returns:
      number of possible insertions for a node

    • nScheduledInsertions

      int nScheduledInsertions(int node)
      give the number of scheduled insertions for a node
      Parameters:
      node - node whose number of scheduled insertions needs to be known
      Returns:
      number of scheduled insertions for a node

    • nInsertions

      int nInsertions(int node)
      give the total number of insertions for a node
      Parameters:
      node - node whose number of insertions needs to be known
      Returns:
      number of insertions for a node nInsertions(n) == nPossibleInsertions(n) + nScheduledInsertions(n)

    • fillInsertions

      int fillInsertions(int node, int[] dest)
      Copies the insertions values of the domain into an array.
      Parameters:
      node - node whose insertions (predecessor candidate) needs to be known
      dest - an array large enough dest.length >= nInsertions(node)
      Returns:
      the size of the insertion domain and dest[0,...,size-1] contains the values in the insertion domain in an arbitrary order

    • isInsertion

      boolean isInsertion(int pred, int node)
      tell if a node is an insertion (possible predecessor) of another node
      Parameters:
      pred - insertion candidate
      node - node that could be inserted after pred
      Returns:
      true if node can be inserted after pred

    • removeInsertion

      void removeInsertion(int pred, int node)
      remove a node from the set of insertions of another node
      Parameters:
      pred - insertion that will be removed
      node - node who will lose the insertion

    • removeInsertionAfter

      void removeInsertionAfter(int node)
      remove all insertion having the specified node as predecessor
      Parameters:
      node -

    • getInsertionVar

      InsertionVar getInsertionVar(int i)
      gives the InsertionVar related to a node in the sequence
      Parameters:
      i - id of the InsertionVar
      Returns:
      InsertionVar with id i

    • whenBind

      void whenBind(Procedure f)
      Asks that the closure is called whenever the domain of this variable is reduced to a single setValue
      Parameters:
      f - the closure

    • whenInsert

      void whenInsert(Procedure f)
      Asks that the closure is called whenever a new node is scheduled into the sequence
      Parameters:
      f - the closure

    • whenExclude

      void whenExclude(Procedure f)
      Asks that the closure is called whenever a new node is excluded from the sequence
      Parameters:
      f - the closure

    • propagateOnBind

      void propagateOnBind(CPConstraint c)
      Asks that CPConstraint.propagate() is called whenever the domain of this variable is reduced to a singleton. In such a state the variable is bind and we say that a bind event occurs.
      Parameters:
      c - the constraint for which the CPConstraint.propagate() method should be called on bind events of this variable.

    • propagateOnInsert

      void propagateOnInsert(CPConstraint c)
      Asks that CPConstraint.propagate() is called whenever a new node is scheduled into the sequence We say that a bound change event occurs in this case.
      Parameters:
      c - the constraint for which the CPConstraint.propagate() method should be called on bound change events of this variable.

    • propagateOnExclude

      void propagateOnExclude(CPConstraint c)
      Asks that CPConstraint.propagate() is called whenever a new node is excluded from the sequence We say that a bound change event occurs in this case.
      Parameters:
      c - the constraint for which the CPConstraint.propagate() method should be called on bound change events of this variable.

    • isBound

      boolean isBound()
      Returns:
      true when no more node belongs to the set of possible nodes

    • nextMember

      int nextMember(int node)
      Parameters:
      node - node in the scheduled sequence
      Returns:
      index of the successor of the node. Irrelevant if the node is not in the sequence

    • predMember

      int predMember(int node)
      Parameters:
      node - node in the scheduled sequence
      Returns:
      index of the predecessor of the node. Irrelevant if the node is not in the sequence

    • fillOrder

      int fillOrder(int[] dest)
      fill the current order of the sequence into an array large enough, including beginning and ending node
      Parameters:
      dest - array where to store the order of the sequence
      Returns:
      number of elements in the sequence, including beginning and ending node

    • fillOrder

      int fillOrder(int[] dest, boolean includeBounds)
      fill the current order of the sequence into an array large enough
      Parameters:
      dest - array where to store the order of the sequence
      includeBounds - if True, includes the beginning and ending node into the order array
      Returns:
      number of elements in the sequence

    • ordering

      String ordering()
      give the ordering of nodes without the beginning and end nodes
      Returns:

    • ordering

      String ordering(boolean includeBounds)
      give the ordering of nodes with the beginning and end nodes
      Parameters:
      includeBounds - if the bounds (begin() and end()) must be included or not
      Returns:
      ordering of the sequence, with " -> " between 2 consecutive nodes

    • ordering

      String ordering(boolean includeBounds, String join)
      give the ordering of nodes with the beginning and end nodes
      Parameters:
      includeBounds - if the bounds (begin() and end()) must be included or not
      join - string that must be used to join two consecutive nodes
      Returns:
      ordering of the sequence
